content:
TITLE: Installing AzureAuth on Windows using PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell installation script that downloads and installs AzureAuth to the local machine. It sets up the application in %LOCALAPPDATA%\Programs\AzureAuth and adds it to PATH. Requires specifying the version number via environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
$env:AZUREAUTH_VERSION = '0.9.1'
$script = "${env:TEMP}\install.ps1"
$url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-cli/${env:AZUREAUTH_VERSION}/install/install.ps1"
[Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12
Invoke-WebRequest $url -OutFile $script; if ($?) { &$script }; if ($?) { rm $script }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing AzureAuth on macOS using Bash
DESCRIPTION: Bash installation script that downloads and installs AzureAuth to $HOME/.azureauth on macOS. It adds the binary to PATH and updates shell configuration files. Requires specifying the version number via environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export AZUREAUTH_VERSION='0.9.1'
curl -sL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-cli/$AZUREAUTH_VERSION/install/install.sh | sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic AzureAuth Authentication Command
DESCRIPTION: Command for authenticating a client to a resource under a tenant, specifying client ID, resource ID, tenant ID, and desired output format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth aad --client <clientID> --resource <resourceID> --tenant <tenantID> --output <output format>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample TOML Configuration File for AzureAuth
DESCRIPTION: Example TOML configuration file with aliases for different authentication contexts, including resource IDs, client IDs, domains, and tenant IDs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: toml
CODE:
```
[alias.alias1]
# The resource ID
resource = "67eeda51-3891-4101-a0e3-bf0c64047157"
# The client ID
client = "73e5793e-8f71-4da2-9f71-575cb3019b37"
domain = "contoso.com"
tenant = "a3be859b-7f9a-4955-98ed-f3602dbd954c"

[alias.alias2]
resource = "ab7e45b7-ea4c-458c-97bd-670ccb543376"
client = "73e5793e-8f71-4da2-9f71-575cb3019b37"
domain = "fabrikam.com"
tenant = "a3be859b-7f9a-4955-98ed-f3602dbd954c"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: JSON Output Format for AzureAuth
DESCRIPTION: Format of the JSON output returned when using the '--output json' option with AzureAuth, including user email, display name, token, and expiration date.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "user": "<user@example.com>",
    "display_name": "User Name",
    "token": "<encoded token>",
    "expiration_date": "<expiration date in unix format>"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Azure DevOps PAT with AzureAuth
DESCRIPTION: Command for creating an Azure DevOps Personal Access Token (PAT) using AzureAuth, specifying organization, display name, scope, and prompt hint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth ado pat --organization Contoso --display-name NuGetPackages --scope vso.packaging --prompt-hint NuGetPackages
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing AzureAuth Uninstallation Script in PowerShell
DESCRIPTION: This PowerShell script downloads and executes the uninstallation script for AzureAuth from GitHub. It sets up TLS 1.2, downloads the script to the temp directory, executes it, and then removes the script if execution was successful.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/uninstall.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
$script = "${env:TEMP}\uninstall.ps1"
$url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-cli/main/install/uninstall.ps1"
[Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12
Invoke-WebRequest $url -OutFile $script; if ($?) { &$script }; if ($?) { rm $script }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using AzureAuth ADO Token Command
DESCRIPTION: Simple command for obtaining an Azure DevOps token using the built-in defaults, which is equivalent to using the aad command with ADO-specific parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth ado token
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Equivalent ADO Token Command with Explicit Parameters
DESCRIPTION: The expanded form of the 'ado token' command, showing the default parameters that are implicitly used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth aad --client <default ADO client> --tenant <tenantID> --scope <default ADO scope>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Custom Timeout with AzureAuth
DESCRIPTION: Command for authenticating with AzureAuth using a custom timeout of 10 minutes and 45 seconds, specified as a decimal number of minutes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth aad --alias alias1 --timeout 10.75
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using AzureAuth with Alias and Config File
DESCRIPTION: Command for authenticating with AzureAuth using an alias defined in a configuration file, specifying the config file path explicitly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth aad --alias alias1 --config <path to the config file>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using AzureAuth with Environment Variable for Config
DESCRIPTION: Command for authenticating with AzureAuth using an alias when the AZUREAUTH_CONFIG environment variable is set to the config file path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth aad --alias alias1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring WAM Redirect URI for Azure App Registration
DESCRIPTION: URI format needed when configuring Windows Authentication Manager (WAM) as a custom redirect URI in your Azure AD app registration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
ms-appx-web://Microsoft.AAD.BrokerPlugin/<ClientID>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Localhost Redirect URI for System Web Browser
DESCRIPTION: URI needed when configuring system web browser authentication in your Azure AD app registration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
http://localhost
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Python example with AzureAuth
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the Python example script that demonstrates integration with the AzureAuth executable. This example references the win10-x64 build of AzureAuth.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/examples/python/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python examples\python\azureauth.py src\AzureAuth\dist\win10-x64\AzureAuth.exe
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the AzureAuth executable in Windows
DESCRIPTION: Command to build and publish the AzureAuth executable for testing Python integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/examples/python/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bin\publish.cmd
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Python Dependencies List for Microsoft Authentication CLI
DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive list of Python package dependencies with pinned versions required for the Microsoft Authentication CLI project. The dependencies include Azure DevOps SDK, HTTP request libraries, authentication packages, and utility libraries for parsing and handling data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/bin/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
azure-devops==6.0.0b4
certifi==2024.7.4
charset-normalizer==2.1.1
idna==3.7
isodate==0.6.1
msrest==0.6.21
oauthlib==3.2.2
requests==2.32.0
requests-oauthlib==1.3.1
six==1.16.0
urllib3==1.26.19
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Auth CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Auth CLI with help option, including build step
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
dotnet run --project src\AzureAuth -- --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute project tests using dotnet CLI
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
dotnet test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Repository
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the Microsoft Authentication CLI repository from GitHub
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/AzureAD/microsoft-authentication-cli
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Windows Project Build
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the project using dotnet CLI
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
dotnet build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resetting Device ID for AzureAuth Telemetry
DESCRIPTION: Command to reset the telemetry device ID used by AzureAuth (only used when telemetry is enabled, which is off by default).
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/docs/usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
azureauth info reset-device-id
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: macOS Interactive Restore
DESCRIPTION: Command to run interactive restore with authentication
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
dotnet restore --interactive
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: macOS Credential Provider Setup
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Artifacts Credential Provider plugin on macOS
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -fsSL https://aka.ms/install-artifacts-credprovider.sh | sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Windows Solution Launch
DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the Visual Studio solution file on Windows
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: batch
CODE:
```
start AzureAuth.sln
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Benchmark Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the benchmark project in release configuration
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
dotnet run --configuration release --project .\src\MSALWrapper.Benchmark
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Specific Benchmark
DESCRIPTION: Command to run a specific benchmark by specifying the startup object
SOURCE: https://github.com/azuread/microsoft-authentication-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
dotnet run --configuration release --project .\src\MSALWrapper.Benchmark --property:StartupObject=Microsoft.Authentication.MSALWrapper.Benchmark.BrokerBenchmark
```
